252.question: Which other approaches do they compare their model with?

6-Table3-1.png: Link et al. (2012), Akbik et al. (2018), Our model, Wiki (GOLD).
Our model, Akbik et al. (2018), Link et al. (2012), and NA.

252.answer: Akbik et al. (2018), Link et al. (2012)

253.question: Which other approaches do they compare their model with?

6-Table3-1.png: Link et al. (2012), Akbik et al. (2018), Our model, Wiki (GOLD).
Our model, Akbik et al. (2018), Link et al. (2012), and NA.

253.answer: They compare to Akbik et al. (2018) and Link et al. (2012).

254.question: What results do they achieve using their proposed approach?

5-Table2-1.png: The proposed approach achieves 79% precision, 59% recall, and 66% F-1 score for the person class, and 79% precision, 59% recall, and 66% F-1 score for the location class.
5-Figure3-1.png: They achieve actual predicted location, predicted location, actual location, predicted product/computer, actual product/computer, and predicted location/city.

254.answer: F-1 score on the OntoNotes is 88%, and it is 53% on Wiki (gold).

256.question: How do they combine a deep learning model with a knowledge base?

4-Figure2-1.png: They combine a deep learning model with a knowledge base by using the output of the deep learning model to identify entities in the text and then passing those entities into a knowledge base.

256.answer: Entities from a deep learning model are linked to the related entities from a knowledge base by a lookup.
